meanings.definition: Ignorant of or uninterested in cultures, ideas, or peoples outside one's own experience.
meanings.sent1: The small town was so insular that they rarely welcomed outsiders.
meanings.sent2: She had an insular mindset, only caring about her immediate surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The insular group refused to try new foods, sticking to their familiar dishes.
meanings.sent4: His insular attitude towards foreign films limited his enjoyment of diverse cinema.
meanings.sent5: Growing up in a remote village made her insular, unaware of global events.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of an island.
meanings.sent1: The palm trees and sandy beaches gave the resort an insular feel.
meanings.sent2: The unique flora and fauna were insular to that specific island.
meanings.sent3: The insular ecosystem thrived due to its isolation from the mainland.
meanings.sent4: The island's insular culture was evident in their traditional dances.
meanings.sent5: Living on the insular island, she felt a strong connection to the sea.

meanings.definition: Narrow-minded or isolated in outlook or experience.
meanings.sent1: His insular views on politics made it hard for him to see other perspectives.
meanings.sent2: The insular community shunned anyone who didn't conform to their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: Their insular thinking prevented them from embracing new technologies.
meanings.sent4: She realized her insular upbringing had limited her understanding of the world.
meanings.sent5: The insular neighborhood rarely interacted with the rest of the city.
